title: How to Block All Incoming Calls on an Android Phone

steps.title: Open the Settings app .
steps.content: Open the Settings app . To do so, swipe down from the top of the screen to open the Notifications panel. Then tap the icon that resembles a gear in the upper-right corner. This method will work with devices running stock Android, such as Google Pixel phones. However, a different method will need to be used on a stock Android device, such as Google Pixel .

steps.title: Tap Notifications.
steps.content: Tap Notifications . It's next to an icon that resembles a text message bubble in the Settings menu.

steps.title: Tap Do not disturb.
steps.content: Tap Do not disturb . It's towards the bottom of the Notifications menu.

steps.title: Tap the toggle switch to turn on "Do not disturb."
steps.content: Tap the toggle switch to turn on "Do not disturb." It's at the top of the menu. This activates Do Not Disturb. Alternatively, you can swipe down from the top of the screen twice to open the Quick Settings menu. Swipe left or right to view all the Quick Settings options. Then tap the Do Not Disturb icon, which resembles a circle with a line through it. Return to this menu and tap this button when you want to allow calls again.

steps.title: Tap Calls and messages.
steps.content: Tap Calls and messages . It's below the "Allowed during Do not disturb" header.

steps.title: Tap Calls.
steps.content: Tap Calls . It's the first option below the "Also allow" header.

steps.title: Tap None.
steps.content: Tap None . This ensures that no calls are allowed when "Do Not Disturb" is turned on.

steps.title: Tap the toggle switch next to "Repeat callers" (optional).
steps.content: Tap the toggle switch next to "Repeat callers" (optional). If you want to allow people to reach you in an emergency by calling you twice within a 15-minute period, you can tap the toggle switch to allow repeat callers to reach you. Otherwise, you can leave this option off to block all incoming calls. If you want to allow notifications from messages or apps during "Do Not Disturb," you can adjust those settings in the "Do Not Disturb" menu in the Settings menu.

steps.title: Open the Settings app .
steps.content: Open the Settings app . To do so, swipe down from the top of the screen to open the Notifications panel. Then tap the icon that resembles a gear in the upper-right corner. This method will work with devices running stock Android, such as Google Pixel phones. However, a different method will need to be used for Samsung Galaxy devices .

steps.title: Tap Sound & vibration.
steps.content: Tap Sound & vibration . It's next to an icon that resembles a speaker in the Settings menu.

steps.title: Tap Do Not Disturb.
steps.content: Tap Do Not Disturb . It's below the alarm volume slider bar. This displays options for activating "Do Not Disturb."

steps.title: Tap Turn on Now.
steps.content: Tap Turn on Now . It's the large button at the top of the menu. This activates Do Not Disturb. Alternatively, you can swipe down from the top of the screen twice to open the Quick Settings menu. Swipe left or right on the screen to view all the Quick Settings options. Tap Do Not Disturb when you see it. Return to this menu and tap this button when you want to allow calls again.

steps.title: Tap People.
steps.content: Tap People . It's below the "What can interrupt Do Not Disturb" header.

steps.title: Tap Calls.
steps.content: Tap Calls . It's the second option on the list.

steps.title: Tap the radio option next to None.
steps.content: Tap the radio option next to None. It's the last option in the list. This blocks all incoming calls.

steps.title: Turn off "Allow Repeat Callers" (optional).
steps.content: Turn off "Allow Repeat Callers" (optional). If you want to allow people to reach you in an emergency by calling you twice within a 15-minute period, you can tap the toggle switch to allow repeat callers to reach you. Otherwise, you can leave this option off to block all incoming calls. If you want to allow notifications from messages or apps during "Do Not Disturb," you can adjust those settings in the "Do Not Disturb" menu in the Settings menu.

steps.title: Open the Phone app.
steps.content: Open the Phone app. It’s the phone receiver icon that’s usually at the bottom of the home screen.

steps.title: Click ⁝.
steps.content: Click ⁝ . It’s near the top-right corner of the screen. This displays a pop-up menu.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . It's at the bottom of the menu that appears when you tap the icon with three dots.

steps.title: Tap Supplementary services.
steps.content: Tap Supplementary services . It's towards the bottom of the Call Settings menu.

steps.title: Tap Call barring.
steps.content: Tap Call barring . It should be one of the options in the Supplementary services menu. If you don't have all Call Barring, contact your mobile service provider. Alternatively, you can use Call Forwarding to forward calls to a fake number.

steps.title: Tap the toggle switch next to "All incoming calls."
steps.content: Tap the toggle switch next to "All incoming calls." This will block all incoming calls.

steps.title: Enter the 4-digit code.
steps.content: Enter the 4-digit code. If you’re unsure of the code, try 0000 or 1234. If this doesn’t work, call your provider to request the code. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap OK.
steps.content: Tap OK . All incoming calls are now blocked. To unblock calls later, return to this screen and tap the toggle switch to turn it off.

steps.title: Tap Call Forwarding.
steps.content: Tap Call Forwarding . This displays the call forwarding options.

steps.title: Tap Always forward.
steps.content: Tap Always forward . It's the first option at the top of the menu.

steps.title: Enter a fake number and tap Turn on.
steps.content: Enter a fake number and tap Turn on . This can be any fake number. Something as simple as "111 111 1111" will do. Then tap Turn on on to activate call forwarding. All calls will be forwarded to the number you entered and the caller will receive an error message. To turn off Call Forwarding, return to this menu and tap Always forward . Then tap Turn off .
